intro: Wepferia, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Wepferia species are typically low-growing, mat-forming plants with fleshy, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The genus is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
